page.title: 15Bumpstead Hall.
page.content: The front of the house is 400 years old and the back is 200 years old. It was the hall for Helions Bumpstead. The{Gurteen family}owned it.Then Ian Gemmell and his father in law took over in 1984.The back of the house was for servants.They were separated from the rest of the household by green baize doors which still remain. The butler's pantry is near the dining room.{The farm}has 340 acres 131 of wheat,100 of barley,(45 acres for malting) 56 of oilseed rape, 36 acres of linseed, 21 acres of durum.There is a pond and a pumping shed for pumping water out of it. There is a combine harvester, a drill and a grain dryer. The barns date back to Tudor times. Now they have to be repaired and it will take Â£ 30,000 to Â£40,000 to do the job.
